result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L McManus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CORRECTED to grant defendant CFTS
Consecutive to: Ct 2

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically Racine Vocational Ministry/re-entry program. May not live with SG unless approved by agent. Must be in a program to guard against relapse. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Jail time may be served in the Wisconsin Prison System.
